Detailed Description

Header file for the MIBHandler (Common/MIBHandler.c), an entity holding and managing the contents of a generic MIB (a tree structure which can be accessed using OIDs).

Copyright (2005) © Amdocs, All Rights Reserved

This software is distributed on an "AS IS" basis, WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND either expresses or implied.

Id:
MIBHandler.h,v 1.8 2005/01/30 15:41:24 guyg Exp

Define Documentation

00416     int i;

IPDR_Status MIBHandler_ExternalSet (  MIBHandler *    MH,
IPDR_OID *    O,
const char *    Value
) 
 

Set a value in the MIB from an external source (such as an SNMP agent).

Parameters:
MH  MIB handler
O  OID to set
Value  value to set
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 

00124 {
00125     MIBNode *N;
00126 
00127     removeOIDtrailingZeros(O);
00128 
00129     N = MIBHandler_FindNode(MH, O);
00130     if (N == NULL)
00131         return IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_FOUND;
00132 
00133     if (! N->Writable)
00134         return IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_WRITABLE;
00135 
00136     Util_StrDupAndReplace(MH->PS, Value, & (N->Value));
00137 
00138     /* check if a change callback is defined and trigger if found */
00139     while (N) {
00140         if (N->ChangeCallback != NULL)
00141             N->ChangeCallback(O, N, N->ChangeCallbackArg);
00142         N = N->Parent;
00143     }
00144 
00145     return IPDR_OK;
00146 }

IPDR_Status MIBHandler_Get (  MIBHandler *    MH,
IPDR_OID *    O,
const char **    Value,
unsigned int *    Type,
IPDR_BOOL *    Persistent,
IPDR_BOOL *    Writable
) 
 

Get a value of an OID in the MIB.

Parameters:
MH  MIB handler
O  OID to get value of
Value  OID's value (output)
Type  OID type (output)
Persistent  is it persistent? (output)
Writable  is it writable? (output)
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 

00286 {
00287     MIBNode *N = MH->RootNode;
00288 
00289     removeOIDtrailingZeros(O);
00290 
00291     /* find the object corresponding to the current OID */
00292     N = MIBHandler_FindNode(MH, O);
00293     if (N == NULL) {
00294         if (Value) {
00295             *Value = NULL;
00296         }
00297         return IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_FOUND;
00298     }
00299 
00300     if (Value) {
00301         if (N->ValueCallback) {
00302             *Value = N->ValueCallback(O, N, N->ValueCallbackArg);
00303         } else {
00304             *Value = N->Value;
00305         }
00306     }
00307     if (Type) {
00308         *Type = N->Type;
00309     }
00310 
00311     if (Persistent) {
00312         *Persistent = MIBHandler_IsPersistent(MH, O);
00313     }
00314 
00315     if (Writable) {
00316         *Writable = N->Writable;
00317     }
00318 
00319     return IPDR_OK;
00320 }

char** MIBHandler_GetChildValues (  MIBHandler *    MH,
IPDR_OID *    O,
int *    NumChildren
) 
 

return a vector of values of child nodes of the given OID. (The caller is responsible for freeing the returned values array (not the values themselves).

Parameters:
MH  MIB handler
O  OID to get child values of a node
NumChildren  number of children (output)
RETURN VALUE: Array of child values. 

00240 {
00241     MIBNode *N;
00242     char **Vec;
00243     int i;
00244 
00245     removeOIDtrailingZeros(O);
00246 
00247     N = MIBHandler_FindNode(MH, O);
00248     if (N == NULL)
00249         return NULL;
00250 
00251     if (N->ChildNodes.Length == 0)
00252         return NULL;
00253 
00254     if (Platform_MEMORYALLOCATEVEC(MH->PS,
00255                                    N->ChildNodes.Length,
00256                                    Vec) != IPDR_OK) {
00257         X_MEMPANICVEC(N->ChildNodes.Length, Vec, __FILE__, __LINE__);
00258         return NULL;
00259     }
00260 
00261     *NumChildren = N->ChildNodes.Length;
00262 
00263     for (i = 0; i < N->ChildNodes.Length; i++)
00264         Vec[i] = ((MIBNode *) N->ChildNodes.Data[i])->Value;
00265 
00266     return Vec;
00267 }

IPDR_Status MIBHandler_GetNextOID (  MIBHandler *    MH,
IPDR_OID *    InOID,
IPDR_OID *    OutOID
) 
 

Given an OID returns the next OID in the MIB (in DFS order).

Parameters:
MH  MIB handler
InOID  value of current OID
OutOID  value of the next OID (output)
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 

00334 {
00335     MIBNode *N, *Parent = NULL, *N1;
00336     int i;
00337 
00338     removeOIDtrailingZeros(InOID);
00339 
00340     /* in case no initial OID is specified, get the first one */
00341     if (InOID->Length == 0) {
00342         for (i = 0; i < MH->RootNode->ChildNodes.Length; i++) {
00343             N = (MIBNode *) MH->RootNode->ChildNodes.Data[i];
00344             if (N != NULL) {
00345                 OutOID->OIDArray[0] = i + 1;
00346                 OutOID->Length = 1;
00347                 return IPDR_OK;
00348             }
00349         }
00350         return IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_FOUND;
00351     }
00352 
00353     N = MH->RootNode;
00354 
00355     /* find the object corresponding to the current OID */
00356     for (i = 0; i < InOID->Length; i++) {
00357         N = N->ChildNodes.Data[InOID->OIDArray[i] - 1];
00358         if (N == NULL)
00359             return IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_FOUND;
00360     }
00361 
00362     /* copy the input OID to the output one */
00363     memcpy(OutOID, InOID, sizeof(IPDR_OID));
00364 
00365     /* if the node has children, return the first non null child */
00366     if (N->ChildNodes.Length > 0) {
00367         for (i = 0; i < N->ChildNodes.Length; i++) {
00368             N1 = (MIBNode *) N->ChildNodes.Data[i];
00369             if (N1 != NULL) {
00370                 OutOID->Length++;
00371                 OutOID->OIDArray[OutOID->Length - 1] = i + 1;
00372                 return IPDR_OK;
00373             }
00374         }
00375     }
00376 
00377     Parent = N->Parent;
00378 
00379     for (;;) {
00380 
00381         if ((int) OutOID->OIDArray[OutOID->Length - 1] < Parent->ChildNodes.Length) {
00382             OutOID->OIDArray[OutOID->Length - 1]++;
00383             N = (MIBNode *) Parent->ChildNodes.Data[OutOID->OIDArray[OutOID->Length - 1] - 1];
00384             if (N != NULL)
00385                 return IPDR_OK;
00386         } else {
00387             N = Parent;
00388             if (N == NULL) {
00389                 /* we're at the last node in the MIB, return an error */
00390                 return IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_FOUND;
00391             }
00392             Parent = N->Parent;
00393             OutOID->Length--;
00394             if (! OutOID->Length)
00395                 return IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_FOUND;
00396         }
00397     }
00398 
00399     /* NOTREACHED */
00400     return IPDR_OK;
00401 }

IPDR_Status MIBHandler_InitializeMIB (  MIBHandler *    MH,
IPDR_PlatformServices *    PS
) 
 

Initialize a new MIB handler structure

Parameters:
MH  MIB handler
PS  platform services associated with the handler
RETURN VALUE: Status IPDR_OK on success, error code otherwise. 

00661 {
00662     IPDR_Status Status;
00663 
00664     MH->PS = PS;
00665 
00666     Status = DynamicArray_Create(MH->PS, & (MH->NameDefinitions), 0);
00667     if (Status != IPDR_OK)
00668         return Status;
00669 
00670     Status = Object_Allocate(MH->PS, sizeof(MIBNode),
00671                              MIBNode_Destructor, (void **) & (MH->RootNode));
00672     if (Status != IPDR_OK)
00673         return Status;
00674 
00675     DynamicArray_Create(MH->PS, & (MH->RootNode->ChildNodes), 0);
00676     MH->RootNode->Persistent = IPDR_FALSE;
00677     MH->RootNode->Writable = IPDR_FALSE;
00678     MH->RootNode->Value = NULL;
00679     MH->RootNode->Type = -1; /* it'll never have a value */
00680     MH->RootNode->Parent = NULL;
00681     MH->RootNode->ChangeCallback = NULL;
00682     MH->RootNode->ChangeCallbackArg = NULL;
00683     MH->RootNode->ValueCallback = NULL;
00684     MH->RootNode->ValueCallbackArg = NULL;
00685 
00686     return IPDR_OK;
00687 }

IPDR_Status MIBHandler_Remove (  MIBHandler *    MH,
IPDR_OID *    O
) 
 

Remove the given node and its children

Parameters:
MH  MIB handler
O  OID to remove.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 

00480 {
00481     MIBNode *N = MIBHandler_FindNode(MH, O);
00482     MIBNode *Parent = N->Parent;
00483 
00484     DynamicArray_RemoveAndShift(MH->PS, & (Parent->ChildNodes),
00485                                 O->OIDArray[O->Length - 1] - 1);
00486 
00487     return IPDR_OK;
00488 }

Returns:

00466         return IPDR_ERR_MIB_NODE_NOT_FOUND;
00467     DynamicArray_Reset(MH->PS, & (N->ChildNodes), 0);

IPDR_Status MIBHandler_Set (  MIBHandler *    MH,
IPDR_OID *    O,
const char *    Value,
unsigned int    Type,
IPDR_BOOL    Writable
) 
 

Set a value in the MIB.

Parameters:
MH  MIB handler
O  OID to set
Value  value to set
Type  type of the value (one of the IPDR types)
Writable  true if the value is editable from an external source, false if it's read only.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 

00163 {
00164     IPDR_Status Status;
00165     MIBNode *N1, *N = MH->RootNode;
00166     int i;
00167 
00168     removeOIDtrailingZeros(O);
00169 
00170     /* Find the object corresponding to the OID, creating intermediate
00171      * nodes. */
00172     for (i = 0; i < O->Length; i++) {
00173         N1 = NULL;
00174         if ((int) O->OIDArray[i] - 1 < (int) N->ChildNodes.Length)
00175             N1 = N->ChildNodes.Data[O->OIDArray[i] - 1];
00176         if (N1 == NULL) {
00177             Status =
00178                 Object_Allocate(MH->PS, sizeof(MIBNode), MIBNode_Destructor,
00179                                 (void **) & N1);
00180             if (Status != IPDR_OK)
00181                 return Status;
00182             N1->Value = NULL;
00183             N1->Type = -1;
00184             N1->Parent = N;
00185             N1->Persistent = IPDR_FALSE;
00186             N1->Writable = IPDR_FALSE;
00187             N1->ChangeCallback = NULL;
00188             N1->ChangeCallbackArg = NULL;
00189             N1->ValueCallback = NULL;
00190             N1->ValueCallbackArg = NULL;
00191 
00192             Status = DynamicArray_Create(MH->PS, & (N1->ChildNodes), 0);
00193             if (Status != IPDR_OK) {
00194                 Object_Release(MH->PS, N1);
00195                 return Status;
00196             }
00197             Status = DynamicArray_SetElementAt(MH->PS, & (N->ChildNodes),
00198                                                O->OIDArray[i] - 1, N1);
00199             if (Status != IPDR_OK) {
00200                 Object_Release(MH->PS, N1);
00201                 return Status;
00202             }
00203         }
00204         N = N1;
00205     }
00206 
00207     Util_StrDupAndReplace(MH->PS, Value, &N->Value);
00208 
00209     /* N->Writable |= Writable should do the same as the following line */
00210 
00211     if (! N->Writable)
00212         N->Writable = Writable;
00213 
00214     /* Type of -1 is used for "no type", which is a little weird with
00215      * Type being an unsigned int. But there's no real harm in this
00216      * test and things do work out all around ... some day, we should
00217      * change the enumertion for types to include a "unknown"
00218      * value. */
00219 
00220     if (Type >= 0)
00221         N->Type = Type;
00222 
00223     return IPDR_OK;
00224 }

IPDR_Status MIBHandler_StringToOID (  MIBHandler *    MH,
const char *    Str,
IPDR_OID *    O
) 
 

Convert a string (in the format a.b.c.d.e...) to an OID (based on the name definitions)

Parameters:
MH  MIB handler
Str  string to convert to an OID
O  OID (output)
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 

00540 {
00541     int i;
00542     if (! O) { return IPDR_ERR_INVALID_VALUE; }
00543     *O = IPDR_ZeroOID;
00544     if (! Str) { Str = ""; }
00545     for (i = 0; i < IPDR_MAX_OID_SIZE; i++) {
00546         O->OIDArray[i] = 0;
00547     }
00548     return MIBHandler_AppendStringToOID(MH, Str, O);
00549 }
